canonical.name: Ken
canonical.title: 52. Ken / The Stilling, The Mountain
canonical.judgment: When one's resting is like that of the back, and they lose all consciousness of self; when they walk in their courtyard, and do not see any of the persons in it, there will be no error.
canonical.image: Two trigrams representing a mountain, one over the other, form Ken. The superior person, in accordance with this, does not go in their thoughts beyond the duties of the position in which they are.

1.text: shows its subject keeping their toes at rest. There will be no error; but it will be advantageous for them to be persistently firm and correct

2.text: shows its subject keeping the calves of their legs at rest. They cannot help the subject of the line above whom they follow, and are dissatisfied in their mind.

3.text: shows its subject keeping their loins at rest, and separating the ribs from the body below. The situation is perilous, and the heart glows with suppressed excitement.

4.text: shows its subject keeping their trunk at rest. There will be no error.

5.text: shows its subject keeping their jawbones at rest, so that their words are all orderly. Occasion for repentance will disappear.

6.text: shows its subject devotedly maintaining their restfulness. There will be good fortune.

metadata.notes: Original translation preserved from pyChing v1.2.2
